keyFacts: Jeffrey E. Epstein declared this document to be his last will and testament, revoking all prior wills and codicils.
Epstein bequeathed all his property to 'The Jeffrey E. Epstein 2001 Trust One', a trust he created on November 8, 2001.
Jeffrey A. Schantz and Paul Hoffman were appointed as executors of the will, with Schantz granted authority to designate or remove additional executors.
The will stipulates that no executor is required to post a bond, file periodic court reports, or give notice of appointment to any court.
